clear_essay_sentences.text: More recently, in the second half of the 20th century, the first developments in genetic engineering began.
At first it was mice, crops.
In the 90s, the world-famous lamb Dolly appeared.
Following it, the first commercial products with ge-netic modification appeared - Flavr Savr tomatoes.
These tomatoes did not spoil for a long time, there was no need to spend money on special gas.
Such tomatoes re-tain their taste for much longer.
Genetic engineering brings a lot of useful now.
But for some reason everyone decided that it was dangerous and should be banned in some countries, for example, in Russia.
Markings WITHOUT GMOs filled all products and became a stupid marketing move.
Not only is this a false la-bel, because no one can distinguish a GM product from a non-GM product.
So, it is also hung on everything that is possible, even where there can be no genes at all - salt, sodium chloride, inorganic compound.
Previously, they used radioactive radiation and various mutagens so that mu-tations occurred more often, and it was possible to choose a suitable sample.
No one knew exactly what mutations were happening, they just chose by type and measured the composition.
And when a way appeared to purposefully insert the desired genes, it became dangerous, it was scary to eat GM products, but irradiated products weren't ...
I hope that someday this unreasonable fear will disappear.
Perhaps when I get older, I'll take up scientific education in order to accelerate the approach of this bright world with rational methods of growing plants and animals with the neces-sary qualities.

standard_markup.text:
More recently, in the second half of the 20th century, the first developments in genetic engineering began. At first it was mice, crops. In the 90s, the world-famous lamb Dolly appeared. Following it, the first commercial products with ge-netic modification appeared - Flavr Savr tomatoes. These tomatoes did not spoil for a long time, there was no need to spend money on special gas. Such tomatoes re-tain their taste for much longer. Genetic engineering brings a lot of useful now.
But for some reason everyone decided that it was dangerous and should be banned in some countries, for example, in Russia. Markings WITHOUT GMOs filled all products and became a stupid marketing move. Not only is this a false la-bel, because no one can distinguish a GM product from a non-GM product. So, it is also hung on everything that is possible, even where there can be no genes at all - salt, sodium chloride, inorganic compound.
Previously, they used radioactive radiation and various mutagens so that mu-tations occurred more often, and it was possible to choose a suitable sample. No one knew exactly what mutations were happening, they just chose by type and measured the composition. And when a way appeared to purposefully insert the desired genes, it became dangerous, it was scary to eat GM products, but irradiated products weren’t ...
I hope that someday this unreasonable fear will disappear. Perhaps when I get older, I’ll take up scientific education in order to accelerate the approach of this bright world with rational methods of growing plants and animals with the neces-sary qualities.

essay_sentences.text: More recently, in the second half of the 20th century, the first developments in genetic engineering began.
At first it was mice, crops.
In the 90s, the world-famous lamb Dolly appeared.
Following it, the first commercial products with ge-netic modification appeared - Flavr Savr tomatoes.
These tomatoes did not spoil for a long time, there was no need to spend money on special gas.
Such tomatoes re-tain their taste for much longer.
Genetic engineering brings a lot of useful now.
But for some reason everyone decided that it was dangerous and should be banned in some countries, for example, in Russia.
Markings WITHOUT GMOs filled all products and became a stupid marketing move.
Not only is this a false la-bel, because no one can distinguish a GM product from a non-GM product.
So, it is also hung on everything that is possible, even where there can be no genes at all - salt, sodium chloride, inorganic compound.
Previously, they used radioactive radiation and various mutagens so that mu-tations occurred more often, and it was possible to choose a suitable sample.
No one knew exactly what mutations were happening, they just chose by type and measured the composition.
And when a way appeared to purposefully insert the desired genes, it became dangerous, it was scary to eat GM products, but irradiated products we are not ...
I hope that someday this unreasonable fear will disappear.

Perhaps when I get older, I will take up scientific education in order to accelerate the approach of this bright world with rational methods of growing plants and animals with the neces-sary qualities.
